heading: satellite failure hits ap
subheading: the ge-3 satellite spins out of control, forcing the associated press to turn to the internet to distribute its news stories.
author: wired news report
text: a satellite that distributes material for the associated press was spinning out of control friday morning, causing "widespread disruption" of the news giant's service throughout north america. engineers were attempting to regain control of the ge-3 satellite, a major telecommunications satellite that serves all of north america. if they are unable to do so, the agency would switch its servers to a backup satellite, the ap said.the incident is reminiscent of the may 1998 misadventures of the galaxy iv. in that case, the guidance system aboard a satellite malfunctioned, knocking out millions of pagers and disrupting other communications services in the united states.with the ge-3 out of commission, the ap said it was turning to the internet to get its news reports out to customers.the ge-3 is a satellite of recent vintage, and there was no immediate explanation for its bizarre behavior. "it was put into service in september 1997 and has an expected life of 12 to 15 years," the ap said.
